core.map.movingrule

Class UncutNeighborMovingRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.map.movingrule.MovingRule
      • core.map.movingrule.UncutNeighborMovingRule

  • class UncutNeighborMovingRule
extends MovingRule
    UncutNeighborMovingRule implements all MovingRule operations and overrides one operation.

    UncutNeighborMovingRule implements getForcedDirections(map,currentPoint,direction) of MovingRule by defining the two points behind an obstacle, placed diagonal behind to the currentPoint, as a forced points.

    UncutNeighborMovingRule overrides isCornerCut(map,currentPoint,direction) by forbidding Corner Cutting as an accepted movement on the map.

    All orthogonal movements are allowed as long as the reached point is passable. All diagonal movements are allowed as long as the reached point is passable and no obstacle is cut.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Patrick Loka
    See Also:
    MovingRule, MovingRuleStrategy

    • Method Detail

      • getForcedDirections

        public java.util.Collection<Vector> getForcedDirections(MapFacade map,
                                                        Vector currentPoint,
                                                        Vector direction)
        Returns all forced directions based on passed obstacles.

        A valid implementation returns all forced directions considering the implementation specific definition of a forced point considering the accepted moving rules.

        Implementation: Define every two points behind an obstacle, placed diagonal behind to the currentPoint, as a forced points.
        Specified by:
        getForcedDirections in class MovingRule
        Parameters:
        map - map to apply moving rules.
        currentPoint - A passable point on the map.
        direction - The direction vector in {-1,0,1}^2 in which the currentPoint was reached.
        Returns:
        A set of all directions d: currentPoint + d = forced point.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        AllNeighborMovingRule, UncutNeighborMovingRule, OrthogonalNeighborMovingRule

      • isCornerCut

        public boolean isCornerCut(MapFacade map,
                           Vector currentPoint,
                           Vector direction)
        Returns true, if a corner is cut without permission by moving in input direction by leaving currentPoint. Otherwise returns false.

        Default Implementation(Corner Cutting is allowed): Corner is independent of the input never cut.

        Implementation(Corner Cutting is forbidden): A Corner is cut, iff there is an obstacle in any subordinatedDirection.
        Overrides:
        isCornerCut in class MovingRule
        Parameters:
        map - map to apply moving rules.
        currentPoint - A passable point on the map.
        direction - The direction vector in {-1,0,1}^2 in which the currentPoint is leaving.
        Returns:
        True, if a corner is cut by moving in input direction by leaving currentPoint. Otherwise return false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        UncutNeighborMovingRule
